refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The GtkTable functions allow the programmer to arrange widgets in rows and columns, making it easy to align many widgets next to each other, horizontally and vertically.
Tables are created with a call to gtk_table_new(), the size of which can later be changed with gtk_table_resize().
Widgets can be added to a table using gtk_table_attach() or the more convenient (but slightly less flexible) gtk_table_attach_defaults().
To alter the space next to a specific row, use gtk_table_set_row_spacing(), and for a column, gtk_table_set_col_spacing().
The gaps between all rows or columns can be changed by calling gtk_table_set_row_spacings() or gtk_table_set_col_spacings() respectively.
gtk_table_set_homogeneous(), can be used to set whether all cells in the table will resize themselves to the size of the largest widget in the table.

refsect2.title: struct GtkTable
refsect2.para:
The GtkTable structure holds the data for the actual table itself.
children is a GList of all the widgets the table contains. rows and columns are pointers to GtkTableRowCol structures, which contain the default spacing and expansion details for the GtkTable's rows and columns, respectively.
nrows and ncols are 16bit integers storing the number of rows and columns the table has.

refsect2.title: struct GtkTableChild
refsect2.para: The widget field is a pointer to the widget that this GtkTableChild structure is keeping track of. The left_attach, right_attach, top_attach, and bottom_attach fields specify the row and column numbers which make up the invisible rectangle that the child widget is packed into.
xpadding and ypadding specify the space between this widget and the surrounding table cells.

refsect2.title: struct GtkTableRowCol
refsect2.para: These fields should be considered read-only and not be modified directly.

refsect2.title: gtk_table_new ()
refsect2.para: Used to create a new table widget. An initial size must be given by specifying how many rows and columns the table should have, although this can be changed later with gtk_table_resize(). rows and columns must both be in the range 0 .. 65535.

listitem.simpara: The number of rows the new table should have.
The number of columns the new table should have.
If set to TRUE, all table cells are resized to the size of the cell containing the largest widget.
A pointer to the the newly created table widget.

refsect2.title: gtk_table_resize ()
refsect2.para: If you need to change a table's size after it has been created, this function allows you to do so.

listitem.simpara: The GtkTable you wish to change the size of.
The new number of rows.
The new number of columns.

refsect2.title: gtk_table_attach ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gtk_table_attach (GtkTable *table, GtkWidget *child, guint left_attach, guint right_attach, guint top_attach, guint bottom_attach, GtkAttachOptions xoptions, GtkAttachOptions yoptions, guint xpadding, guint ypadding);
refsect2.para: Adds a widget to a table. The number of 'cells' that a widget will occupy is specified by left_attach, right_attach, top_attach and bottom_attach. These each represent the leftmost, rightmost, uppermost and lowest column and row numbers of the table. (Columns and rows are indexed from zero).

listitem.simpara: The GtkTable to add a new widget to.
The widget to add.
the column number to attach the left side of a child widget to.
the column number to attach the right side of a child widget to.
the row number to attach the top of a child widget to.
the row number to attach the bottom of a child widget to.
Used to specify the properties of the child widget when the table is resized.
The same as xoptions, except this field determines behaviour of vertical resizing.
An integer value specifying the padding on the left and right of the widget being added to the table.
The amount of padding above and below the child widget.

refsect2.title: gtk_table_attach_defaults ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gtk_table_attach_defaults (GtkTable *table, GtkWidget *widget, guint left_attach, guint right_attach, guint top_attach, guint bottom_attach);
refsect2.para: As there are many options associated with gtk_table_attach(), this convenience function provides the programmer with a means to add children to a table with identical padding and expansion options.

listitem.simpara: The table to add a new child widget to.
The child widget to add.
The column number to attach the left side of the child widget to.
The column number to attach the right side of the child widget to.
The row number to attach the top of the child widget to.
The row number to attach the bottom of the child widget to.

refsect2.title: gtk_table_set_row_spacing ()
refsect2.para: Changes the space between a given table row and its surrounding rows.

listitem.simpara: a GtkTable containing the row whose properties you wish to change.
row number whose spacing will be changed.
number of pixels that the spacing should take up.

refsect2.title: gtk_table_set_col_spacing ()
refsect2.para: Alters the amount of space between a given table column and the adjacent columns.

listitem.simpara: a GtkTable.
the column whose spacing should be changed.
number of pixels that the spacing should take up.

refsect2.title: gtk_table_set_row_spacings ()
refsect2.para: Sets the space between every row in table equal to spacing.

listitem.simpara: a GtkTable.
the number of pixels of space to place between every row in the table.

refsect2.title: gtk_table_set_col_spacings ()
refsect2.para: Sets the space between every column in table equal to spacing.

listitem.simpara: a GtkTable.
the number of pixels of space to place between every column in the table.

refsect2.title: gtk_table_set_homogeneous ()
refsect2.para: Changes the homogenous property of table cells, ie. whether all cells are an equal size or not.

listitem.simpara: The GtkTable you wish to set the homogeneous properties of.
Set to TRUE to ensure all table cells are the same size. Set to FALSE if this is not your desired behaviour.

refsect2.title: gtk_table_get_default_row_spacing ()
refsect2.para: Gets the default row spacing for the table. This is the spacing that will be used for newly added rows. (See gtk_table_set_row_spacings())

listitem.simpara: a GtkTable
value: the default row spacing

refsect2.title: gtk_table_get_homogeneous ()
refsect2.para: Returns whether the table cells are all constrained to the same width and height. (See gtk_table_set_homogenous())

listitem.simpara: a GtkTable
TRUE if the cells are all constrained to the same size

refsect2.title: gtk_table_get_row_spacing ()
refsect2.para: Gets the amount of space between row row, and row row + 1. See gtk_table_set_row_spacing().

listitem.simpara: a GtkTable
a row in the table, 0 indicates the first row
the row spacing

refsect2.title: gtk_table_get_col_spacing ()
refsect2.para: Gets the amount of space between column col, and column col + 1. See gtk_table_set_col_spacing().

listitem.simpara: a GtkTable
a column in the table, 0 indicates the first column
the column spacing

refsect2.title: gtk_table_get_default_col_spacing ()
refsect2.para: Gets the default column spacing for the table. This is the spacing that will be used for newly added columns. (See gtk_table_set_col_spacings())

listitem.simpara: a GtkTable
value: the default column spacing

listitem.para: The amount of space between two consecutive columns.
If TRUE this means the table cells are all the same width/height.
The number of columns in the table.
The number of rows in the table.
The amount of space between two consecutive rows.
